pullRequest.title: Update GeoJSON APIs to use Geo instead of Geometry
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR updates the GeoJSON implementation in azure-core-experimental in the following ways:

Changed model types prefix from Geometry to Geo.
Changed the package from spatial to geojson.
Added GeoArray which acts as a generic representation of all coordinates in a GeoObject type.
Removed direct access of additionalProperties to only allow property getting, renamed usage to customProperties.
Added GeoObjectType enum which represents a GeoObject's type.
Added array-like getters to access GeoObject property coordinates along side the named getters.
Added GeoLinearRing to represent a GeoPolygon type more closely to the RFC definition.

commit.message: Update GeoJSON APIs to use Geo instead of Geometry
Added GeoArray as a generic representation of the coordinates for GeoObjects
Updated from master and cleaned up module-infos

nodes.bodyText: Why do we need json in this package name? Can we just use geo or geometry? Not sure if we should be including the serialization format for these types.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,334 @@

nodes.bodyText: I agree. Let's not do too much validation here. Service can do this validation.
